trans-unit.source: The base class for all objects that have dependency properties.
This class must be inherited.
When implemented in a derived class, initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> class.
Adds a handler for an event of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref>.
When you create a delegate, you identify the method that handles the event.
To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event.
Unless you remove the delegate, the event handler is called whenever the event occurs.
Multiple delegates can be added to handle an event.
For more information about event-handler delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Object> that represents the value of this property.
In this case, a <xref:System.Delegate> type.
Either of the arguments is a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic).
The dependencyEvent represents a non-event .
Gets the value that indicates whether this instance is in design or run-time mode.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this instance is in design mode; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Releases all the resources used by the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref>.
Releases the unmanaged resources and optionally releases the managed resources used by <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Provided as an override to <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to clean up any unmanaged resources deterministically.
Typically, this is required only when unmanaged resources such as raw HWNDS, Win32 files handlers, and others are released.
Provides access to the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref> associated with the specific <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref> associated with the specific <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Retrieves the <xref:System.Object> that is the subject of an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Object> that is the subject of an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind>.
When overridden in a derived class, this method can be used to customize the way in which a specified binding is resolved.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Type> of the target of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Object> that is the subject of an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref>.
targetType is a null reference ().
To be added.
To be added.
Provides access to the value of the designated <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
This member is typically used in property gets to furnish the value of the named dependency value.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
The object that represents the value of the designated <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.

Provides access to the bound object of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> and bypasses the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValue*> override.
This method is useful inside the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValue%2A> override implementation.
Typically, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValue%2A> override code invokes the GetValueBase, and then adds additional code.

For implementing the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValue%2A> override, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.PropertyMetadata> can be used in <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty.Register%2A>/<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached%2A> calls.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> to get the value of.
The bound object of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
This bypasses the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.GetValue*> override.
dependencyProperty is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Performs initialization on dependency properties when overridden in a derived class.
Called by the workflow runtime engine during the initialization of the activity at run time.
Indicates whether the value of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> is set as a binding.
See <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding*>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> to test.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if set as a binding; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
dependencyProperty is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

Determines whether the <xref uid="langword_csharp_metaproperties" name="metaproperties" href=""></xref> of this <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> equals the <xref uid="langword_csharp_metaproperties" name="metaproperties" href=""></xref> of the parameterized <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref>.
This uses the `==` operator as defined for the type of private member `metaproperties`, which is <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> to compare with for equality.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref uid="langword_csharp_metaproperties" name="metaproperties" href=""></xref> are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the parent <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> graph.
The parent <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> graph.
Removes an <xref:System.EventHandler> from an associated <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
Provided as a convenient direct method for removing an event delegate.
When you create a delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event.
To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event.
Unless you remove the delegate, the event handler is called whenever the event occurs.
For more information about event-handler delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Object> that represents the value of this property.
In this case, a <xref:System.Delegate> type.
Either of the arguments is a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic).
The dependencyEvent is not an event.
The value is a and this instance is not in .
Removes a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> to be removed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if operation was successful; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The argument is a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic).
Sets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> sets the value directly to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty>.
Similarly, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A> adds a handler directly to properties of type event.
These methods are exclusive when they are called for the same property.

If SetBinding is called, then the values previously set using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> (<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A> in events) are disregarded.

The same is true the other way around: <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> (<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A>) resets the binding assigned with SetBinding.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref> to set to.
Either of the arguments is a null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.PropertyMetadata"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> is not bindable.
This instance is not in <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.DesignMode*>.
Sets the value of the target <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Object> to set the target of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityBind"></xref>.
bind is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Sets the value of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>, which is read-only.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Object> that represents the value.
The dependencyProperty is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> to the object.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding%2A> sets a binding for the dependency property.

SetValue sets a value directly to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty> (similarly, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A> adds a handler directly to properties of type event).
These methods are exclusive when they are called for the same property.

If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding%2A> is called, then the values previously set using SetValue (<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A> in events) are disregarded.

The same is true the other way around: SetValue (<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.AddHandler%2A>) resets the binding assigned with <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetBinding%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> to be set.
The <xref:System.Object> to set the value to.

Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> to the specified <xref:System.Object>, bypassing the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue*>.
This method is useful inside the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> override implementation.
Typically, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> override code would do some custom logic before calling the SetValueBase method.

For setting a <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject.SetValue%2A> override, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.PropertyMetadata> can be used in <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty.Register%2A>, or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached%2A> calls.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref> to be set to the <xref:System.Object>.
The <xref:System.Object> that becomes the value of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyProperty"></xref>.
dependencyProperty is a null reference ( in Visual Basic).
Gets or sets a reference to the Site component of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref>.
The Site component of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref>.
Gets an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> that associates custom data with this class instance.
This property is a `metaproperty`, which means it is immutable at run time.
`Metaproperties` do not change after a property instance is created at run time, so the property must be set to a literal value at design time.
This property is not used in the default <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> declaration implementations provided by Windows Workflow Foundation.
This collection is not serialized; data that the collection contains is not persisted from design time to run time.

A dictionary that acts as an extensibility hook for developers to manipulate <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.DependencyObject"></xref> declarations for a design tool and associate custom data with individual activity declarations.
